Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; traces of band in added red or white; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of Scythian archer and horseman to right (midsection of archer including part of quiver and patterned trousers, one hind leg and tail of horse, ends of two spears of rider and arrow of archer held almost horizontally remaining).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 280-1, no. B242)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0156) (Phase 1)
